column4: Alright so that worked, if your XFCE menu stops working delet .config/xfce4/desktop/menu.xml ...
Well the system resources you "save" will (in most cases) go to extra disk cache. That is unless you've got a pittyful amount of RAM.
Gnome uses more ram than xfce but the processing power required isn't all that much freater afaik.
You will notice a greater laod time and 256 ram is a bit short for running gnome imo. Well unless you intend only to run gnome an no applications on top then it's ok. :p
